item.title: Fight the repetitions
item.description: Do your developers have to perform monotonous tasks that require almost no thought? Are there almost identical fragments in the code?Do you notice code that has been written using the “copy-paste-modify” method?If the answers are positive, then your team is working slower than it could be, and, strangely enough, the reason for that might be you. Before we delve into explanations, let’s agree on two truths regarding software development: -Duplication is evil. Repetitive work slows down development. As an architect, you set the tone.You have the best understanding of the system as a whole, and most likely, it was you who set the direction of the work by creating a complete vertical cross-section of the system â€“ an example that has been repeatedly copied by now.
